Description: Limestone ostracon, a letter, with remains of ten lines of Coptic text written in black ink on one side, the Register records the presence of a further seven lines of text on the other side. Text contains a letter with an invitation.
Bibliographic references: Hall 1905 / Coptic and Greek Texts of the Christian Period from Ostraka, Stelae, etc. in the British Museum (p.74, pl.55)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (82710) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/82710)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Brit.Mus.Copt. I 55:2 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
